definition: richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
silver/silver-colored/relating to money or currency

sentences.english: He won't ask me to wear jewels and glitter.
sentences.chinese: 他從不要求我穿金戴銀。

sentences.english: An ape is an ape, though decked with gold.
sentences.chinese: 儘管穿金戴銀，仍然是猿猴。

red in the face/extremely angry
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to play deaf-mute
to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to keep up with the latest fashion
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
burly chap/husky fellow
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
poetic and passionate (idiom); romance/love affair
manner/style/panache
to help with farm work/casual laborer
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
